meanings.definition: A sudden burst of light or flame
meanings.sent1: The camera captured a bright flash of light.
meanings.sent2: I saw a quick flash of lightning in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The flash from the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a flash of sunlight breaking through the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The flash of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.

meanings.sent1: He will flash a smile when he sees you.
meanings.sent2: The idea suddenly flashed into her mind.
meanings.sent3: The magician will flash onto the stage in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The memory of that day will always flash in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The answer will flash into your head when you least expect it.

meanings.sent1: The car will flash by in a blur of color.
meanings.sent2: The bird will flash past the window in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel will flash across the yard with an acorn in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: Time will flash by when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The shooting star will flash across the night sky, leaving a trail of light.
